result.execSummary:
The defendant Dionte Ledonis Churchwell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
-Provide DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge during probation; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered.
-Pay all mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges during probation; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered.
-Court waived all non mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges finding the defendant indigent.
-No contact with victim T.B.J, except for third party contact for purposes of the children.

-Complete Batterers Intervention class.
-Mental health assessment and cooperate with any treatment deemed necessary by the probation department.

-Absolute sobriety.
-AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary  by the probation agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dionte Ledonis Churchwell

records.addlTxt: Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: EAB.

Defendant Dionte Ledonis Churchwell in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dionte Ledonis Churchwell appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Status Conference held.  Defense counsel requests plea and sentencing hearing date.  Case adjourned, Br. 10.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Dionte Ledonis Churchwell in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties appeared by video conference.
Defense is requesting Justice Point monitoring level be lowered due to defendant's job.  State does not object.  Court will allow justice point monitoring to be lowered to the defendant have to report to Justice Point once a month. All other previous bail conditions remain the same. Parties are still negotiating and requesting a status conference.  Case is adjourned to 5-25-22 at 8:30 am for status conference, by zoom.  Status conference scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with TBJ.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.

  DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00  P.M. ON (4-4-22). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Dionte Ledonis Churchwell in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
